description.para: We provide an interface for users to define a BRDF and its associated methods. All the functions receive an arbitrary void pointer where the programmer can store needed parameters. An "instance" of a BRDF is meant to be located at a certain point and to a certain viewing direction. The programmer must take care of this and store it in the arbitrary data pointer.

memberdef.definition: typedef AtVector(* AtBRDFEvalSampleFunc) (const void *brdf_data, float rx, float ry)
memberdef.name: AtBRDFEvalSampleFunc

detaileddescription.para: Returns a direction according to some distribution based on the reflectance of the BRDF.

memberdef.definition: typedef AtColor(* AtBRDFEvalBrdfFunc) (const void *brdf_data, const AtVector *indir)
memberdef.name: AtBRDFEvalBrdfFunc

detaileddescription.para: Returns the actual reflectance from a given direction to the viewer's direction.

memberdef.definition: typedef float(* AtBRDFEvalPdfFunc) (const void *brdf_data, const AtVector *indir)
memberdef.name: AtBRDFEvalPdfFunc

detaileddescription.para: Returns the probability density for the above sample function at a certain incoming direction.

memberdef.argsstring: (AtShaderGlobals *sg, const void *brdf_data, AtBRDFEvalSampleFunc eval_sample, AtBRDFEvalBrdfFunc eval_brdf, AtBRDFEvalPdfFunc eval_pdf)
